info.description:
The Absence Management service enables:

* Accessing worker information about leaves of absence and time off details.
* Requesting time off and leaves of absence.
info.title: absenceManagement

tags.name: balances
tags.description: Provides the ability to get absence plan and leave of absence balances.

tags.name: workers
tags.description:
Retrieves absence management information about workers and allows the requesting of time off.

This endpoint and its subresources can be referenced with either an ID or the "me" named entry.
* Referencing a specific worker: /workers/{ID}/...
* Referencing the current user using the named entry: /workers/me/...

tags.name: Prompt Values
tags.description: Retrieves instances that can be used as values for other endpoint parameters in this service.

get.summary: Retrieves the leave of absence for the specified worker.
get.description: Retrieves information about the leave of absence for the worker with the specified ID. Secured by: Self-Service: Leave of Absence, Worker Data: Leave of Absence Scope: Time Off and Leave

parameters.name: ID
parameters.description: The Workday ID of the resource.

parameters.name: subresourceID
parameters.description: The Workday ID of the subresource.

200.description: Successful response. A successful response can return no matched data.

get.description: The status of the event that tracks the requested time off. Secured by: Self-Service: Leave of Absence, Worker Data: Leave of Absence Scope: Time Off and Leave

200.description: Successful response. A successful response can return no matched data.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of objects in a single response. The default and maximum is 1000.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The zero-based index of the first object in a response collection. The default is 0. Use offset with the limit parameter to control paging of a response collection. Example: If limit is 5 and offset is 9, the response returns a collection of 5 objects starting with the 10th object.

get.summary: Retrieves a collection of eligible absence types for the specified worker.
get.description: Retrieves all the eligible absence types for the specified worker ID for a category type. If you don't specify a query parameter, this will get all time off types, absence tables, and leave types a worker is eligible for. Specify the category to filter the result based on absence type. Secured by: FLW Service, Request Leave for Self+TG+TG-TG, Request Leave of Absence (REST Service), Request Time Off (REST Service), Request \~Time Off\~ for Self+TG+TG-TG Scope: Time Off and Leave

parameters.name: ID

The Workday ID of the absence type category. Valid values:
* Leave of Absence Type: 17bd6531c90c100016d74f8dfae007d0 

* Absence Table: 17bd6531c90c100016da3f5b554007d2

* Time Off: 17bd6531c90c100016d4b06f2b8a07ce

parameters.description: The effective date for which eligible absence types need to be returned for the worker.

Example: If limit is 5 and offset is 9, the response returns a collection of 5 objects starting with the 10th object.

200.description: Successful response. A successful response can return no matched data.

get.summary: Retrieves the Leaves Of Absence for a specified worker ID.
get.description: Retrieves Leaves Of Absence for a specified worker ID for a date range, status, and type. If you don't specify query parameters, this method returns all Leaves Of Absence. If you specify a date range, this method returns Leaves Of Absence events based on First Day Of Leave, Estimated Last Day Of Leave, and Actual Last Day Of Leave. The Actual Last Day Of Leave is used only if the Request Return from Leave business process is completed, else the Actual Last Day Of Leave is assumed to be blank. In particular, this method: * Returns an event if the Actual Last Day Of Leave is blank and the Estimated Last Day Of Leave is in the past but before the fromDate or toDate parameters. * Does not return an event if the Actual Last Day Of Leave is blank and the Estimated Last Day Of Leave is in the future but before the fromDate or toDate parameters. Secured by: Self-Service: Leave of Absence, Worker Data: Leave of Absence Scope: Time Off and Leave

parameters.name: ID
parameters.description: The Workday ID of the resource.

parameters.name: fromDate
parameters.description: The start of a date range filter using the yyyy-mm-dd format.

parameters.name: leaveType
parameters.description: The Workday ID of the type of leave of absence. You can specify multiple leaveType query parameters.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of objects in a single response. The default is 20. The maximum is 100.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The zero-based index of the first object in a response collection. The default is 0. Use offset with the limit parameter to control paging of a response collection. Example: If limit is 5 and offset is 9, the response returns a collection of 5 objects starting with the 10th object.

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: The Workday ID of the status of the leave of absence. The valid statuses are Successfully Completed, In Progress, Canceled, Rescinded, and Process Terminated. To get valid values, call the GET /values/leave/status endpoint. You can specify multiple status query parameters.

parameters.name: toDate
parameters.description: The end of a date range filter using the yyyy-mm-dd format.

200.description: Successful response. A successful response can return no matched data.

get.summary: Retrieves the balance of all absence plan and leave of absence type for the specified worker ID.
get.description: Retrieves the balance of all absence plan and leave of absence type for the specified worker ID. You can filter the balances by category, effective date, and worker. Specify category to filter the result based on absence type. There are 3 category types: * Leave of Absence Type, 17bd6531c90c100016d74f8dfae007d0 * Absence Table, 17bd6531c90c100016da3f5b554007d2 * Time Off, 7bd6531c90c100016d4b06f2b8a07ce Secured by: Self-Service: Leave of Absence Entitlements, Self-Service: Time Off Balances, Worker Data: Leave of Absence, Worker Data: Time Off (Time Off Balances Manager View), Worker Data: Time Off (Time Off Balances) Scope: Time Off and Leave

parameters.name: category
parameters.description: The Workday ID of the time off, leave type, or absence table.

parameters.name: effective
parameters.description: The absence balances as of the specified date using the yyyy-mm-dd format.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of objects in a single response. The default is 20. The maximum is 100.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The zero-based index of the first object in a response collection. The default is 0. Use offset with the limit parameter to control paging of a response collection. Example: If limit is 5 and offset is 9, the response returns a collection of 5 objects starting with the 10th object.

parameters.name: worker
parameters.description: The Workday ID of the worker for which balances are returned. This is a required query parameter.

200.description: Successful response. A successful response can return no matched data.

post.summary: Creates a time off request for the specified worker ID and initiates the business process.

parameters.name: ID
parameters.description: The Workday ID of the resource.

400.description:
Invalid request. (https://community.workday.com/rest/error-messages)
Error Code | Validation Message
--- | ---
A165 | The attachment category is invalid for this business process.
A175 | The file is required.
A178 | The business process has already been initiated.
A200 | You can't comment on this business process type.
A205 | You don't have the security permission on this business process to add attachments.
A206 | Attachments are not enabled for this business process.
A207 | You've exceeded the attachment file size limit of [tenant setup attachment limit]KB.
A211 | The attachment category is required.
A219 | The business process action isn't valid.
A221 | The attachment category isn't enabled for this business process.
A228 | [customer event validation message]
A1006 | [absence REST API max unpaid warning time off error message]
A1007 | [absence REST API consecutive day minimum warning time off error message]
A1008 | Some of the start and end times you're trying to submit overlap with start and end times for an existing time off request on the same date(s). Edit your start and end times so that they don't overlap.
A1009 | Type is required and must have a value.
A1011 | You don't have a sufficient balance or aren't eligible to satisfy the request for [type] as of [date].
A1012 | Requires End Time

A1015 | [absence REST API max unpaid critical time off error message]
A1016 | Enter an hourly or daily quantity that is greater than zero.
A1017 | Daily Quantity is required and must have a value.
A1018 | [absence REST API increment critical time off error message]
A1019 | [absence REST API multiple time offs warning time off error message]
A1020 | The request can't have a Total Hourly or Daily Quantity of zero.
A1021 | [REST Validation Message - Time Off Reason Not Valid for Time Off]
A1022 | [absence REST API max critical time off error message]
A1023 | [absence REST API increment warning time off error message]
A1025 | [absence REST API consecutive day minimum critical time off error message]
A1026 | [REST Validation Message - Position Not Eligible for Time Off Type]
A1027 | [absence REST API consecutive day maximum critical time off error message]
A1028 | Some of the start and end times you're trying to submit overlap with existing time blocks. Edit your start and end times so that they don't overlap.
A1029 | Enter an End Time that is after the Start Time.
A1030 | [REST Validation Message - Position Provided for Worker Based Time Off]
A1032 | You can't have multiple entries for the same Time Off Type for a given date.
A1033 | [REST Validation Message - Invalid Days Included]
A1034 | Requires Start Time
A1036 | [REST Validation Message - Time Off Reason Required But Not Provided]
A1037 | [absence REST API beyond last override warning time off error message]
A1038 | Date is required and must have a value.
A1039 | [absence REST API consecutive day maximum warning time off error message]
A1040 | [absence REST API max warning time off error message]
A1041 | [REST Validation Message - Worker Not Eligible for Time Off Type]
A1042 | [absence REST API multiple time offs critical time off error message]
A1043 | [REST Validation Message - Time Off Reason Not Enabled for Time Off]
A1044 | When the Time Off Type is an Absence Table, ensure that the Position field is blank.
A1045 | [absence REST API min critical time off error message]
A1046 | Start Time and End Time are optional for [Time Off Type]. Enter both values or neither.
A1047 | The dates for the Start and End fields must match the Date field: [date].
A1048 | Your request includes days that aren't allowed for [Time Off Type]. To include the invalid days, provide a different Time Off Type. Otherwise, enter valid dates.
A1050 | [REST Validation Message - Position Needed for Position Based/Required Time Off]
A1052 | [absence REST API beyond last override critical time off error message]
A1509 | [REST Validation Message - Time Off Type with Sell Time Off Checked]
A1726 | [REST Validation Message - Position Needed for Position Based/Required Absence Type]
A1727 | To request time off for a worker against a worker-based absence table, ensure that the Position field is blank.
A1790 | [REST Validation Message - Position Not Eligible for Absence Type]
A2658 | [REST Validation Message - Time Off Type with Forfeiture Adjustment Checked]
A2663 | [REST Validation Message - Time Off Type with Worktag Configured]
A2685 | Specify a start and end date range thatâ€™s less than 24 hours.
A2687 | The date for the Start field must match the Date field: [date].

get.summary: Retrieves a collection of time off details for a specified worker.
get.description: Retrieves the time off entries for the specified worker ID. You can filter by date range, status, and type. If you don't specify query parameters, this method returns all time off entries. Secured by: FLW Service, Self-Service: Time Off, Worker Data: Time Off (Time Off Manager View), Worker Data: Time Off (Time Off) Scope: Time Off and Leave

parameters.name: ID
parameters.description: The Workday ID of the resource.

parameters.name: fromDate
parameters.description: The start of a date range filter using the yyyy-mm-dd format.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of objects in a single response. The default is 20. The maximum is 100.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The zero-based index of the first object in a response collection. The default is 0. Use offset with the limit parameter to control paging of a response collection. Example: If limit is 5 and offset is 9, the response returns a collection of 5 objects starting with the 10th object.

parameters.name: status
parameters.description:
The Workday ID of the time off status. You can specify multiple status query parameters. This method returns the most recent instance of a time off entry based on this query parameter. 

The valid statuses are Approved, Submitted, Not Submitted, and Sent Back. This method does not return Canceled and Denied Time Off Entries. To get the Workday ID of a status, call the GET /values/timeOff/status endpoint. You can specify multiple status query parameters.

Example:
An approved Time Off Entry for Vacation 8 hours was corrected to Vacation 4 hours and is not in submitted status. If the query parameter is status = approved, the Time Off Entry of Vacation, 8 hours, Approved is returned. If query parameter status = submitted, the Time Off Entry of Vacation, 4 hours, Submitted is returned. If no query parameter is passed, the Time Off Entry of Vacation, 4 hours, Submitted is returned.

parameters.name: timeOffType
parameters.description: The Workday ID of the Time Off Type. You can specify multiple timeOffType query parameters.

parameters.name: toDate
parameters.description: The end of a date range filter using the yyyy-mm-dd format.

200.description: Successful response. A successful response can return no matched data.

parameters.name: offset

parameters.name: position

payrollEffect.description: If true, the Leave Of Absence event has an effect on payroll.

professionalLeaveEffect.description: If true, the Leave Of Absence event has a Professional Leave Effect leave impact field.

stockVestingEffect.description: If true, the Leave Of Absence event has an effect on the \~worker's\~ stock vesting schedule. It may require a change to the vesting schedule of any stock grants that the \~worker\~ holds.

schedulingEffect.description: True if the leave event is for a leave type that is configured to allow aÂ \~worker\~Â to be scheduled to work when placed on leave.

inactivateWorker.description: If true, the \~worker\~ on leave will be inactivated in the Workday system. If the leave type is position-based, the \~worker\~ will not be inactive unless the \~worker\~ is on leave for all positions with this effect.

sabbaticalEffect.description: If true, the Leave Of Absence event has an effect on sabbatical eligibility. It may require a manual change to a \~worker's\~ sabbatical records.

continuousServiceAccrualEffect.description: If true, it has an impact on the \~worker's\~ service accrual. It may need a manual change to the \~worker's\~ service accrual.

benefitEffect.description: If true, it may require a change to the \~worker's\~ benefits.

talentEffect.description: If true, Workday removes the \~worker\~ on this type of leave from the \~Worker\~ prompt of select \~worker\~ reviews and feedback in talent.

tenureEffect.description: If true, the Leave Of Absence event has an effect on tenure eligibility. It may require a manual change to a \~worker's\~ tenure records.

absenceAccrualEffect.description: If true, it impacts the \~worker's\~ absence accrual.
